dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/621909258 at Thu Jul  2 18:35:03 UTC 2020

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="logging"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="logging"})

avg by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="logging"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="logging"} offset 1w
)
or
sum by (type) (
  gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="logging"} offset 1w
  or
  gitlab_service_ops:rate{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="logging"} offset 1w
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="logging", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="logging", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="logging", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
    or
    ALERTS{environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="logging", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (environment, alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: elasticsearch_indexing Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: elasticsearch_searching Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for this component within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: stackdriver Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.span:
This resource measures average CPU across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_os_cpu_percent{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[1m]) / 100
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="elastic_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        (elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"} - elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"})
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization Overall

panels.span:
JVM heap memory utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_used_bytes{area="heap", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      /
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_max_bytes{area="heap", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_jvm_heap_memory component saturation: JVM Heap Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg_over_time(elasticsearch_os_cpu_percent{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m]) / 100
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        (
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
          -
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
        )
        /
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Saturation of each thread pool on each node.

Descriptions of the threadpool types can be found at
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-threadpool.html.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, name, exported_type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_active_count{exported_type!="snapshot", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m])
        /
        (avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_threads_count{exported_type!="snapshot", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m]) > 0)
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_thread_pools component saturation: Thread pool utilization

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
This resource measures average CPU across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU per Shard

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="logging", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="logging", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_jvm_heap_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_jvm_heap_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_single_node_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_node_disk_space", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_thread_pools", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_thread_pools", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="go_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_go_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_hpa_instances", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_hpa_instances", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="memory", alert_dashboard="sat_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="open_fds", alert_dashboard="sat_open_fds", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pg_active_db_connections_primary", alert_dashboard="sat_active_db_connections_primary", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pg_active_db_connections_replica", alert_dashboard="sat_active_db_connections_replica", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pgbouncer_async_primary_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_pgbouncer_async_pool_primary", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pgbouncer_single_core", alert_dashboard="sat_pgbouncer_single_core", severity="s2"})
or

or
absent(fake_dne{component="pgbouncer_sync_replica_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_pgbouncer_sync_pool_replica", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="private_runners", alert_dashboard="sat_private_runners", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="rails_db_connection_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_rails_db_connection_pool", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="redis_clients", alert_dashboard="sat_redis_clients", severity="s3"})

absent(fake_dne{component="shared_runners_gitlab", alert_dashboard="sat_shared_runners_gitlab", severity="s4"})
or

or
absent(fake_dne{component="single_node_puma_workers", alert_dashboard="sat_single_node_puma_workers", severity="s2"})
)

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="logging", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="logging", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_jvm_heap_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_jvm_heap_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_single_node_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_node_disk_space", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_thread_pools", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_thread_pools", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="go_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_go_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_hpa_instances", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_hpa_instances", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="memory", alert_dashboard="sat_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="open_fds", alert_dashboard="sat_open_fds", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pg_active_db_connections_primary", alert_dashboard="sat_active_db_connections_primary", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pg_active_db_connections_replica", alert_dashboard="sat_active_db_connections_replica", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="pgbouncer_async_primary_pool", alert_dashboard="sat_pgbouncer_async_pool_primary", severity="s4"})

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="logging", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="logging", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="logging",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph inf
  logging
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage"}),
  1
)

panels.title: System Diagram (Keyed by Error Rates)

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph inf
  logging
end
